Comments_List: History of China through the lens of art.
How to appreciate/think about art and ancient artifacts, Chinese history and culturr

This course was great in simultaneously learning about ancient Chinese history and developing skills in which to analyze and consider works of Chinese art and archaeology. I remember walking into the British Museum and seeing some Chinese bronzes during Spring Break and being able to distinguish from what time period they were from.
I learned about ancient Chinese art and how to analyze art in the context of history.
Good intro, seminar style works well. Getting hands on is a bonus. More clear expectations.
Great discussions, awesome readings, and very thorough seminars and visits to the YUAG. Really can't complain, maybe select topics based more on student interest?
As with most seminars, the discussion could be slow at times but unlike most seminars, we were able to spend most of our time at the YUAG looking at objects.

This class was pretty cool in the sense that we not only got to read about the objects, but we also got to see some of them at the YUAG. I liked it when Dr. Niu would give a brief overview of the history of a time-period at the beginning of class. It would be nice if she did that more.
Yes. Solid class that is fun and engaging.
Yes, amazing class and Professor Niu is amazing. Super relaxed setting, great topics/discussion, and not too heavy of a workload.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in an introduction to art history or if you already have experience in art history, this is a great introduction into Chinese art.
I would recommend this class to another student. The discussions were interesting and the assignments were fun to do.
